text: Hi! Does anyone know if it is possible to edit the dropdown in rich texts to only display p, h1, h2, h3 for instance?
Looks like its not possible, because it might be part of a "Group of Controls" <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields/rich-text-editor>
thanks for reply Andreas:relaxed: I couldn’t find anything in the documentation about the dropdown either.. I guess its locked to all the alternatives

Hello everyone, how can i access the alt description of my blog featured image in the blog index and detail templates with hubl?
Thank you for your help
hello <@UBT0AHWLD>, thank you for your reply. so it is not possible to access the alt text i can choose for the blog posts featuredImage in the settings?
it is possible,  you can get it by using "{{ content.featured_image_alt_text }}"
great! missed that one from the article. Thanks a lot

Quick tip (can't remember the correct property to use but this will help you debug it) click the top right sprocket menu -> Developer Info, you'll get a json with a lot of properties, you can CTRL + F to find your alt text and check the correct path to use
<@UV23JHEJY>, thanks für the reminder. Btw i also use this to format it nicely: <https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/json-viewer/gbmdgpbipfallnflgajpaliibnhdgobh>
Hi, Is there anybody already faced this issue ?
This looks like an issue with partial pre-rendering. I'd recommend reaching out to support and they should triage this issue to my team and we can disable it for you while we investigate
